website_summaries.verdict: The best kick pad for true high-intensity practicing and sparring when a lot of protection is required.
pros: Made from high quality synthetic leather
Full length kick pad surface makes it easy to practice different kick heights without adjusting the pad’s position
Extra length also protects the wearer from stray kicks
cons: Larger surface area makes it more difficult to clean this pad compared to smaller options

website_summaries.verdict: This shield is tough. Able to withstand heavy hits.
pros: The handle placement is perfect, allowing the holder to have comfort and ease
cons: The protective padding on the holder's side is thin so the holder can feel some of the impact

website_summaries.verdict: A combination of leather and foam provides a surface built to withstand high-impact hits.
pros: Flexible in terms of its ability to be used for a variety of high-impact sports
Easy to move from one practice site to another
cons: May not accommodate all football hitting drills

customer_reviews.title: wondering if they are selling defects from the factory on amazon
customer_reviews.text: oh my! where to start this was so wrong the straps were not even the same length on the back.. there were markings on the bag where the straps should have been sewn yikes not even close very poor quality..im surprised that everlasting would sell such poor quality items!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, made well, tough, perfect thickness. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is very durable and thick. The handles are made and attached well. I has 5 handles...top, each side, and 2 on back. It's perfect for every day use, hard or light punches and kicks. My son and I are taking a MMA class and we use this for practice. We are currently collecting for a MMA room and this fits perfect to go with our other stuff. It's a little tough for bare hands, but it's perfect with gloves. I love the shape, how it's put together, how the handles are, and the thickness. I'm glad I found this searching for strike shields! LOVE IT. RECOMMEND. Would buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: So far so good it's big enough like a shield. It's not leather but the material seems sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Richard N.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Appropriate for Most Users
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice strike shield for the price, and I'd buy it again. There are two handles on the back that enable it to work well for different positions and types of strikes. This works well for our elementary-aged children, and I'd be comfortable using it with in-control, serious adults not looking to beat up too badly on their training partner. A heavyweight cage-fighter going 100% would probably want/need to invest in something else...built to take extreme abuse. A solid purchase that I'd make again!
customer_reviews.author: PensFifthCup

customer_reviews.title: Best pad on the market, WAY worth the extra $5-10 per shield.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought about 5-6 "shields" to try to find the one I like. This is it. It's not too hard (like most "kick shields"), and not too soft like some "kid pads". It's perfect for punching in class, for kids AND adults. Sturdy enough vs. kicks, even Thai Kicks. The handles are perfect, not tight, but far from loose, and the bonus handle on the top... Can't even find a use for it, but it's THERE! More goodness that I need. Very happy. Ended up with 3, and returned the others. A+
customer_reviews.author: Shelley DeMaison

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This shield is very soft and is good for beginners. I do personal training and teach kickboxing, so when I'm holding the shield for clients my only complaint is that it doesn't have a handle on both ends for holding it horizontally. This makes it difficult to keep it stable when a client is really putting some force into their jab or kicks.
customer_reviews.author: Rosann Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Small Straps
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my boyfriend and i was able to hold it while he kicked it and it provided a good cushion amount so it didn’t hurt my arms. it’s soft for good kicking practice. However, the straps were super tiny even my dainty arms would just barely fit. so my boyfriend could not fit his big forearms into the back straps for good grip. other than that stitching and everything is pretty standard. so 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: The bag itself is still in good shape but the parts that you hold were frayed ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems okay. The bag itself is still in good shape but the parts that you hold were frayed when we received it. Also, I underestimated the power of my child's kick. This thing is tough to hold for her when she practices karate! Ouch. It still works but I do kind of wish I would have just spent the extra and got her a heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch.
customer_reviews.text: This bag can take a beating and keep on going. Perfect for knees, elbows, fists, or whatever you want to hit it with.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Big, great padding
customer_reviews.text: It's great, it came bigger than I expected, it's a great striking surface.it has handles on every side except the bottom short side (kinda disappointing, but no big deal, plenty of other handles) and two on the back. Great placement of zipper, unlike other bags that have it on the back which you or the pad holder might snag yourself on. I'll be using this a lot, so I'll put an update in in a month or so
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Okay Strike Bag
customer_reviews.text: Okay strike bag. While I thought that tis bag would be able to take significant beatings, I am a little disappointed that this bag appears to collapse after multiple strikes. This bag would be great for children, who don't hit so hard, but for adults striking at full force, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Winner: EVERLAST
customer_reviews.text: Everlast. The name says it all. Everlast is well-known for high quality & great products and this shield does not disappoint. I use this product when teaching a taekwondo class. This shield is tough, well-made and does an excellent job insulating me from hard, jarring kicks. The quality of this shield along with a VERY reasonable price of only about $40 (which is lower than most other similar kicking shields) makes this one an absolute winner. Whether you workout informally with a friend in your backyard or you are a professional martial arts instructor needing a new (or replacement) kicking shield, this particular one is an EXCELLENT choice.
customer_reviews.author: student teacher

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy
customer_reviews.text: We got this to practice our kicks for kickboxing. It's a good size but seems really cheaply made and I know the handles are going to rip off at any moment which makes me alittle upset. But it serves its purpose for now. I just wish we could have found one with sturdier handles.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi M.

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Bag, with One Small Gripe
customer_reviews.text: This is great and durable bag that I've been using for a couple of months now. It definitely doesn't feel like a cheap bag. The only problem I have with the bag is with the straps on the back. One strap is smaller than the other, and it can be difficult for me to squeeze my arm into the strap. Not a deal-killer for me, but I see how others can be frustrated with this. If I was in need of a new kicking bag, I would probably buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Not sustainable for anyone who can actually kick
customer_reviews.text: I recommend loosening up the zipper a bit because my students literally kicked it so hard the air pocket exploded the sewing on it.. I bought 6 of these and 4 are already ruined.. Not a very good product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shield is okay
customer_reviews.text: This bag has handles on the sides and top, as the picture shows. However, there is no handle on the bottom for when the shield is rotated. This in addition to small handles on the back make it difficult to hold a firm grip.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2nd session
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible shield. First, the handles are not placed in a good position where you risk kicking your partner's elbow a lot. Secondly, it is not very sturdy so you have to hold back on your kicks. Third, this split right down the middle the second time I used it. Terrible purchase in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: Really good strike shield to practice all kinds of kicks, combos, and situational training. I used it for Krav Maga training and it worked well. Only complaint is that if you have to hold it against a strong kicker you WILL feel it a little. After a full round of kicks the person holding the shield will start to feel it and will most likely want to switch. Otherwise great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great - but it seems to be missing a handle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Krav Maga - to practice both kicks and knees. From an ergonomic standpoint, the handles feel good, it absorbs most of the impact of the blows- and they are big enough that you can hold them firmly while wearing grappling gloves. The only catch with this is that there is no handle on the bottom of the shield - so if you decided to rotate the pad and use it sideways, you would have to utilize either of the side handles. This becomes difficult to hold. That is the only thing I would change about this pad - otherwise, it is perfect for what we use it for.
customer_reviews.author: OliveSaxer

customer_reviews.title: great pad built to last
customer_reviews.text: purchased 2 of these so when kicking or punching my daughter and wife had one to put behind the other for extra padding. and the work 100% and are built to last. I went with these because the dojo I trained in had the same pads and Iv seen just what kind of abuse they will take. recommended for anyone looking for a great pad. priced good. buy 2 though if you hit hard your partner will thank you
customer_reviews.author: The Frogs

customer_reviews.title: Good for practicing front and side kicks
customer_reviews.text: We use this to practice kicks. It's nice and sturdy and has a nice surface area. We've used it for a few months now and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the quality of this product. I have owned Everlast products before. This product want even leather but explains the low cost. The foam inside will hopefully last bit i doubt the outer cover will.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the Everlast name
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy an kick shield online. I usually get equipment like this in person so I can see and feel it before I buy it. I went out on a limb and got this shield and I’m not disappointed! It’s thinner than I would’ve liked, but it didn’t take away from it resiliency. Its definitely worth it for anyone looking for an inexpensive durable product to help them train at home.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so I could teach my girlfriend some striking techniques.. Seems a very high quality and should last quite a long time
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hockert

customer_reviews.title: Decent strike bag for the price, but nothing like the ASP brand.
customer_reviews.text: Pros This is a decent strike bag for training children and smaller framed people. The price is decent, definitely a lot cheaper than the ASP brand. The bag can itself can take some abuse. Cons The bag is smaller than the ASP brand, as are the rear straps. It's near impossible for me to fit my arm through the rear straps, shield style. The bag is still intact after some rough use, but the stitching around the straps began fraying almost immediately. The bag is also very stiff and doe not absorb impact well.
customer_reviews.author: Force Trooper

customer_reviews.title: ... but after using it I have found that it's pretty good for practicing drills for individual strikes
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was poorly made after taking it outta the box but after using it I have found that it's pretty good for practicing drills for individual strikes. Not bad if your purpose for it is single strike drills
customer_reviews.author: haile selassie9000

customer_reviews.title: Good pad
customer_reviews.text: I have been kicking these for over 30 years. This is a great pad at a good price.. It will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, we've been using a good bit already
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, we've been using a good bit already. Doesn't have the round tubular rubber grips like some do. It has straps made of the same material as the bag so not quite as comfortable, But its still been great to use and has held up well so far. Good for the price
customer_reviews.author: Havik

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this bag higher except that it's pretty flimsy. If you're holding it for someone else to hit, you feel the hit. I bought this so my son could practice some martial arts moves at home with me, but have found it does not provide me with the same level of protection that I get from the bags at our martial arts studio.
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Item is of a good quality. It has handles on each side, so you can use it in any direction. Good for any kind of martial arts.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The everlast strike shield works fine to train at home. The only disadvantage are the straps designed to hold the strike shield in place. You may not be able to fit your arm through them if you are an adult. Other than that it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't seem like the stitches are comprised at all but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: I've v only used this about three and some of the stiches on the handles are fraying already. It doesn't seem like the stitches are comprised at all but it is unsightly and surprising for a new product. It works very well however and the handles have great placement.
customer_reviews.author: Nam Truong

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent products we use this to practice power kicking and punching my kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: KHOA NGOC ANH NGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: When my husband/kids talk back I have them hold this ...
customer_reviews.text: When my husband/kids talk back I have them hold this and I beat on it. If you are a big MMA man beating on this thing though, it's probably not going to do it for you. It's light weight so a kid or woman can hold it without much arm strain. Can't testify to it's longevity, but for moderate/light use it will be okay is my guess.
customer_reviews.author: Mommabear

customer_reviews.title: small handles
customer_reviews.text: Small handles don't let me get my arm all the way through. I have average forearms. Probably wouldn't purchase again. The cushioning is fine though.
customer_reviews.author: playinpearls

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this strike shield to further my fitness goal of being able to punch down a house. So far, excellent. It withstands punches and kicks from me and from my considerably stronger brother without breaking. The only problem is some loose threads on the handles. It seems more like fraying than structurally-problematic stuff, but I will update if it becomes an actual issue. And for under $30, I'm not going to get too worked up about loose threads. I saw this product at a sporting goods store for $55.
customer_reviews.author: J. Donahoe

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 year old son. It is very firm and can take a beating. The handles are sturdy and seem to be well put together. This is a very nice shield and you should be able to get lots of practice with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great little shield for the money
customer_reviews.text: We've used it a couple months now and it's holding up pretty well to the people using it.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Item is a perfect stress reliever for my entire family
customer_reviews.text: Item is a perfect stress reliever for my entire family! Just be sure to hold it away from your face.
customer_reviews.author: TeeJerrr

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids to practice on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6yo son who's learning kajukenbo. I wanted him to be able to practice and strengthen his kicks and punches. I've had it for about 6 months now and it's still holding up great. The material inside and the the outer material are holding up fine. I don't know if I would suggest it for older kids or adults, as I'd imagine that they'd need something with more compact material.
customer_reviews.author: californiagirl

customer_reviews.title: Good first, cheap kick shield.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid for... It does it’s job. If you are low on money, it’s a decent shield to get. If you can upgrade to a thicker shield for $20-30 more, I’d recommend Tiger Claw.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Bernal

customer_reviews.title: My kids - ages 6 and 8 - used this ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids - ages 6 and 8 - used this twice and the stitching started to unravel on the side handle. Returned it and looking for something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Lovestoshop

customer_reviews.title: No bottom handle
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough product, particularly for the price. My one complaint is that it doesn’t have a handle on the bottom like other similar products I’ve used. This wasn’t clear from the photos and description. Makes it tough to hold onto when using as a kick shield for front groin kicks.
customer_reviews.author: MTallman

customer_reviews.title: This has been perfect for my 7yr old son
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for my 7yr old son, who is practices his martial arts. He has beat this think up since getting this in November and it has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: kwvw1981

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking around and buy this product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and perfect for training, might get a second one. It’s like the ones we used in the Marines. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My son got this as a Christmas present and loves it. However the handes are already starting to fray.
customer_reviews.author: Candygirl780

customer_reviews.title: Works great for karate kicks.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for sons karate practice. Takes a beating. So far no rips or tares.
customer_reviews.author: BG24

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice if you're a parent and your child is getting started in any martial art.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's sturdy, and I even fashioned a way to hang it up in my small apt so that I could use it as a heavy bag. PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: This is durable but needs to have handles on all 4 ends. Holding this type of bag is best done horizontally for kicking a wider target.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Walker

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Has taken a good beating and still holding up well. Is a good size and can hold up to some very hard strikes.
customer_reviews.author: Memsmaker

customer_reviews.title: Great gear for teaching my kids
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to teach my young kids taekwondo. It works great for them. It might be a little thin as a kick shield for an adult, but will work great for punches, strikes, and controlled kicks. I'd recommend a larger/thicker one for full force kicks. Terrific for my kids, though.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Ramsdell

customer_reviews.title: Great price compared to toehrs and quality material (not the best bit quality)
customer_reviews.text: Great large pad for the body! I barely feel impact or force!
customer_reviews.author: B Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Unleash the Beast
customer_reviews.text: My son could not wait to unleash his fury on this pad. Recommend this pad for all children participating in martial arts either at home or at their dojang. Helps with developing kicks and punches as well as building up their kicks for power.It also acts as a moving target or an opponent.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: Great shield for home use. Would not hold up to serious and regular training but it's great for home or light use. Would not use for baton training.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed - a very lightweight shield to use for intro to self defense. I used it in class last night and it held up. Delivered very quickly. This is a lightweight bag - won't stand up under rough treatment, but does its job exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Mostly for kids
customer_reviews.text: Pad set pretty solid and durable but handles are too small for adult hands. Difficult To hold this kicking pad. Our studio has handles for which we can slip an arm through for better holding and stability. If wanting something for kids practice this is decent but don't buy if looking for an adult grade product.
customer_reviews.author: user22

customer_reviews.title: Good for practicing hand and foot strikes.
customer_reviews.text: Not particularly fancy, but perfect as a striking bag for my grandson when we practice his karate strikes/kicks. Importantly, not too heavy for me to hold for a while. Plenty of hand holds on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt. Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. It has helped him get better in his karate.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah S.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it but kind of hard to hold on to.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Not for Muay Thai but otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid kick shield, I use it for when I teach self defense classes and when I train clients that do some kickboxing. It is solid for those purposes. Would I want to bring this to Muay Thai as a kick shield, no way on earth. But, for your more average use this is a quality kick shield well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Oldden

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: The Everlast Strike Shield is pretty good quality; except, the bottom zipper unzips as I continuously kick it with all my strength.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: My son has already enjoyed hours working out with it
customer_reviews.text: Solid. My son has already enjoyed hours working out with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super good value. Solid dense pad, yet soft enough so that you are not skinning your knuckles
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: A beginners gift
customer_reviews.text: A quick way to get fit when not intentionally going full steam destroy mode. It is intended for light duty but is safe, sound , and protective.
customer_reviews.author: M××BN

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat at this pricepoint.
customer_reviews.text: I've had better, and far more expensive, striking shields and this won't hold up to the abuses of heavy use by adults. But it's perfect for kids.
customer_reviews.author: BustdKnuklz

customer_reviews.title: He loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Got it fast, my kid is already training with it. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: @clixteammex

customer_reviews.title: I wish the straps
customer_reviews.text: I wish the straps were adjustable or longer at least.
customer_reviews.author: Zander4bears

customer_reviews.title: great product, the logo was centered and it's holding ...
customer_reviews.text: Packaged well, great product, the logo was centered and it's holding up to all the beatings so far lol. It arrived quickly as well. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for basketball drills...
customer_reviews.text: These are great for basketball drills, specifically rebounding. You can get the desired effect, the boys can be more aggressive when they know it's a pad that doesn't push back.
customer_reviews.author: 40 Spesch

customer_reviews.title: Good pad the children!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a very good pad for children! I don't think I would want an adult to be the one kicking! The foam inside is just not dense enough for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Derek N.

customer_reviews.title: Great item and price point
customer_reviews.text: If you are a 300lb kick boxer this may not be for you. If you are purchasing an inexpensive shield for your 5 year old to practice strikes and kicks, this product will exceed your expectations and save you a lot of money. Great item at a great price. I was able to purchase body shield and blocker for less than the body shield alone at the Dojo.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: Great shield!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, handles kicks, shin kicks, punches, elbow strikes well, for myself and my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: The Zipper doesn`t seal the inner compartment very well, ...
customer_reviews.text: The Zipper doesn`t seal the inner compartment very well, so when you vigorously perform knee strikes, you tend to kick all the air out of the Shield and it collapses.
customer_reviews.author: N.k

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to our teaching tools
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product for our new martial arts school. The item in brand new condition as expected. We have used this product in the past at the school we attended and are happy to have it at our school.
customer_reviews.author: Ho Shin Academy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am a kickboxing instructor. this helps me with my one one ones
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: Durable?
customer_reviews.text: Good Bag... don't know how long its gonna last tho.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Neto

customer_reviews.title: Engineered to protect the holder as well as the striker
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure what I was getting at this price point ..... I’m into taekwodo so kicking is what we use this bag for mostly. The bag protects both participants very well. Good buy for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: Awsome strike shield. I use it for Tae Kwon Do. Very well constructed. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Yari Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Great size and functionality. I use it when training baseball hitting and it has held up well thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Knee it hard!
customer_reviews.text: Nice for kicking the crap out of!!! Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's great quality, a great size and a great price. In store I've seen this same strike shield for over $60. I'm excited to put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the brief period of time he did use it he was happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought it. Never uses it. It works well as a dust collector. For the brief period of time he did use it he was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For 2 kiddos to play with, perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this for my boys, it is a good practice they can punch, kick something. Not the best outside material on it, and I can see the handles might come off with serious use, but it will do just fine for them.
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: It'll do
customer_reviews.text: Wish the bag was a little bigger but its pretty thick!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Use it for soccer sessions and it is very effective
customer_reviews.author: Tristan J Longnecker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for MMA combos
customer_reviews.text: I use these strike bags for a MMA fitness class. The downfall for some would be that there is no handle on bottom of the strike bag, however, what I use it for is perfect for changing direction of the pad quickly to accommodate strike combos. The amount of padding is perfect. The only complaint I have was that I was limited on the amount I could purchase at one time, however, the price @ Amazon was more affordable than the chain sporting goods stores.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Everlast Strike Shield
customer_reviews.text: I am sending this back for a refund. I find it basically impossible to use safely. The arm straps are so small...I am 5 4, 160 pounds, I couldn't get my arms through...it was actually cutting off my circulation, uncomfortable, and awkward.
customer_reviews.author: mmdolphingirl

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: As per what the other reviewers mentioned, the handles arrived already fraying. The stitching on it looks like it was done by amateurs and the material looks like it can't take a lot of punishment as well. I got this for my 5 year old son so it's doing the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: A and K

customer_reviews.title: Works great for practicing kicks and punches
customer_reviews.text: Works great for practicing kicks and punches. Good size, and the design of the handles make sense. It's just slightly smaller than what my son uses at his dojo.
customer_reviews.author: S. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Good shock absortion
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest stitching job on the fabric; but gets the job done and the price is right. Absorbs most kicks very comfortably, but serious kickers may still give you a bit of a bruise. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it does what its intended for but I should've gotten a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: LukyCharm143

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product began to show wear after just 6 weeks of moderate usage. I teach a KB class at a corporate fitness center and my members made this thing look like they train Muay Thai in Thailand. It started fraying almost immediately. Then one of the side straps broke. Now the back has split. The tiger kick shield is vastly superior.
customer_reviews.author: Theo Boyce III

customer_reviews.title: I still like the product and will buy them again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two and one of them is for home the other is for our jujitsu class, the one for the class zipper broke after the first day. I still like the product and will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Its not to bad, not as big as I thort it was gona be but it still dose the job. Probly not for the heavy hard kicker but still good. Good for kids. I'm a big guy and have big hands and the handles ant that big for my arms but I get them in there.... Just
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: As a seasoned martial arts instructor, I've used many strike shields. This one is stiff and not a fan of the outer material. It is slippery and hard. Will purchase another brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: vrod2007

customer_reviews.title: I've used professional $100+ pads and this seems just a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used professional $100+ pads and this seems just as tough. It's large and worked well against kicks and punches by kids and adults. I'm sure it'll last us a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs better handles
customer_reviews.text: Needs better handles when holding for someone to kick or punch
customer_reviews.author: badgergirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these in a kids Taekwondo class I teach. Very well made and just what is needed for kicking practice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: The pad itself is great and sturdy but it could use some extra straps ...
customer_reviews.text: The pad itself is great and sturdy but it could use some extra straps on the back and sides for holding it for things like groin strikes or hammer fists.
customer_reviews.author: Doinha
